How does AlphaFold-Multimer contribute t: By predicting the quaternary structures of SARS-CoV-2 spike protein complexes.
By simulating the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
By analyzing the genetic sequences of SARS-CoV-2 variants.
By identifying potential drug targets within the SARS-CoV-2 genome.

The computational cost of running EMA methods on large protein complexes.
The difficulty in visualizing protein quaternary structures accurately.
The limited availability of software tools for EMA method implementation.
What future direction does the paper sug: Integrating large datasets of protein tertiary structures to train EMA methods.

Focusing on the synthesis of novel protein sequences for experimental validation.

What is the primary focus of the paper ': Reviewing deep learning-based methods for estimating the accuracy of protein complex structures.
Developing new deep learning algorithms for protein tertiary structure prediction.

Investigating the role of protein folding in cellular processes.
What promising approach is mentioned for: Using graph neural networks (GNNs) for representing protein structures.
Applying reinforcement learning to optimize protein folding pathways.
